page.title: 07PRESENT STATE OF HEALTH
page.content: At present,there are 7 hospitals in Exeter,providing 1150 staffed beds. Condition Beds Acute sufferers 776 Geriatrics 265 Maternity 49 Special Care Baby Unit 31 Units For Young Disabled 20 Total 1150 61 doctors serve Exeter; a ratio of 1:1721. Regional average = 1:1993. {PROBLEMS 1.Geriatric care & Ophthalmology are carried out in very bad conditions. 2.Orthapaedic services at P.E.O.H.are enduring defects in working conditions 3.Large defecit of Geriatric beds. 4.Long waiting lists for beds. {CONCLUSION.} There is a need for funds to be directed at the Health Service with the aim of improving efficiency.
